keyEvents.title: Luffy Thrown into Level 5 Cell
keyEvents.description: Luffy is thrown into a cell on Level 5, left to die from poison in the frozen wasteland.

keyEvents.title: Arrival at Level 5 - Freezing Hell
keyEvents.description: Bon Clay, Buggy, and Mr. 3 arrive at the gates of Level 5, learning about its extreme cold and dangerous Army Wolves.

keyEvents.title: Battle with Army Wolves
keyEvents.description: The group battles Army Wolves that patrol Level 5 and hunt prisoners.

keyEvents.title: Bon Clay Pulls Luffy Through the Snow
keyEvents.description: Bon Clay drags the dying Luffy through the frozen wasteland on a makeshift sled.

description: Level 5 of Impel Down, known as 'Freezing Hell,' is the exact opposite of Level 4's Burning Hell. It is a frozen wasteland where the temperature is so cold that prisoners either suffer for a lifetime in severe cold or freeze to death. The food given to prisoners is frozen to the point of being virtually inedible. Army Wolves patrol this level, hunting down any prisoners who try to escape.
significance: Level 5 houses criminals with bounties of 100,000,000 Berries and over. It represents one of the most brutal levels of Impel Down, using extreme cold as torture. The contrast between Level 4's heat and Level 5's cold demonstrates the sadistic design of the prison.
geography: A vast frozen wasteland with cells scattered throughout, connected by snowy paths. The entire level is maintained at freezing temperatures.
population: High-bounty criminals with bounties over 100,000,000 Berries
culturalSignificance: Represents the World Government's cruel treatment of high-bounty criminals
historicalEvents: First shown in Episode 437 when Luffy is thrown into a cell here after his defeat by Magellan
